title: What font is this
content:
Please help me find what font this is:

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sinner3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/typophile.com/files/sinner3.jpg) | 30.01 KB |
author: aayaan

comments.content:
I have just searched all of Dafont and most of MyFonts blackletter fonts, and I think this is custom drawn. The tails on the n's are not really in blackletter style, I think, and so I guess they were added. The other lettering seems a bit simplified, probably for legibility, but maybe from lack of lettering skill. I noted a few fonts that could be close enough to be starting points to re-create this: [Wittenberger Fraktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/wittenberger-fraktur-mt/?refby=bowfin), [Royal Bavarian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/royal-bavarian/?refby=bowfin), and [Carol](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/classic/carol/?refby=bowfin).

- Mike Yanega

Very close to **[LHF Monogram English](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Letterhead&ffam=LHF%20Monogram%20English%20-%20Regular&fid=6cfb32514f291f0055c17af51e74eaa1&fsize=60&text=sinner&fit=1)** by Alf Becker & Chuck Davis (2001, Letterhead Fonts) but I can't find it in Letterhead site anymore, maybe they changed the font name?

------------------  
I found it using "Find my Font": [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723055426/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")
I checked New English but it looks like a different font, see for example /i/s/ and the different tail endings on all letters.

Thanks for all of your help.

fvilanakis thank you for your help, I think too the font is LHF Monogram English
